intro: Achyronia tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf achyronia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in arid and rocky environments, often found in desert regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
